description: From New Latin syntēxis, from Ancient Greek σύντηξις (súntēxis, “a melting”).

entries.meaning: (geology) A change in the structure of magma by melting or the assimilation of a different type of rock.
examples: [...] is immaterial whether this magma is derived from a distinct earth shell, or is produced by syntexis between the sima and the sialic rocks.

The patient feels no longer the irritating surface heat which so fatigues him; the syntexis or colliquation is less; he sleeps better, and this antithermic medication does well with forced feeding, [...]
